segments.text: I glance at the open window, and the calmness of the outside world is so inviting.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It makes the chaos inside feel even more pronounced, like two worlds colliding.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman seems blissfully unaware of the water splashing at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a wave of irritation at how she’s missing everything happening around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are in their own little universe, climbing and reaching for cookies like it’s an adventure.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But that unstable stool makes my stomach turn; it’s like a ticking time bomb.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: What if he falls? The thought sends shivers down my spine.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish I could just grab them and pull them away so they wouldn’t get hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Yet there they are, lost in the joy of the moment, and it’s hard not to admire their spirit.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s a relief to see them so full of life, but I can’t shake off the looming dread.
segments.speaker: PAR
